definition: favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: Last year the weather was favourable and the crops were doing well.
sentences.chinese: 去年风调雨顺，作物长势良好。

sentences.english: The weather scientists predicted a fine summer.
sentences.chinese: 气象学家预报，今夏将风调雨顺。

sentences.english: The farmers are much favorably circumstanced by the good weather for crops this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年风调雨顺，对农民非常有利。

sentences.english: Assuming that the weather is favourable, farmers will have a bumper harvest.
sentences.chinese: 假如风调雨顺，今年农民将获丰收。

sentences.english: Farmers will have a good harvest, assuming the weather is favorable.
sentences.chinese: 假如风调雨顺，农民将获得丰收。

sentences.english: They celebrate this holiday in hopes of fair weather and a good crop yield in the coming year.
sentences.chinese: 人们庆祝这个节日，祈求一年风调雨顺好收成。
